snippet: The Exxon Corporation could be ordered to sell some gas stations and refining assets to win  Government approval of its planned acquisition of the Mobil Corporation, according to the agency reviewing the $76.6 billion deal.     William Baer, direc...
lead_paragraph: The Exxon Corporation could be ordered to sell some gas stations and refining assets to win Government approval of its planned acquisition of the Mobil Corporation, according to the agency reviewing the $76.6 billion deal. William Baer, director of the Federal Trade Commission's Bureau of Competition, said today that the agency would look closely at refining competition and also review competition in the marketing of gasoline.
abstract: Federal Trade Commission official William Baer says Exxon Corp may be ordered to sell some gas stations and refining assets to win Government approval of its plan to buy Mobil Corp, House subcommittee hearing; cites concern about California refining markets (M)

headline.main: F.T.C. Says Exxon May Face Asset Sale
